section.p: If you receive an external , you can import it into .
During the import, you can also merge the data from an external into a that already exists in .

Translation MemoryUnicode enablementImporting a Translation Memory can also be part of the conversion of a Translation Memory into Unicode. To convert a Translation Memory into Unicode, you must first export it from and then import it again. In both cases, you select SGML Unicode as export or import format.

ul.li: The to be imported must exist.
If you want to merge the data from the external into an existing , both must have the same source language.

section.title: Calling sequence
section.p:
Select:
The Translation Memory List window from the main window
Optionally the into which to import the external
Importâ€¦ from the File menu
The Import Translation Memory window (see ) is displayed. windowsImport Import windowFigure shows Import window

section.title: Options and parameters

plentry.pd: Select the directory where Translation Memory to be imported is currently stored.
Enter the file name of the Translation Memory to be imported or select one or more entries in the list box.

Select the format of the Translation Memory to be imported
SGML ANSI for the import of external memory databases in the SGML (.EXP) format in ANSI encoding
SGML ASCII for the import of external memory databases in the SGML (.EXP) format in ASCII encoding
SGML UTF16 for the import of external memory databases in the SGML (.EXP) format in Unicode (UTF-16) encoding
TMX for the import of external memory databases in the TMX (Translation Memory Exchange) format
TMX (Trados) for the import of external memory databases in the TMX (Translation Memory Exchange) format which have been exported using the Trados translation tool, for this special import format any RTF tagging contained in the imported segment data is removed S

Contains the name of the to be imported. You can overwrite this name or select one from the list box.
If you specify a that does not exist yet, the New Translation Memory window is displayed for you to create it (see ).
If you select or specify an existing , the contents of the to be imported are merged into it.

section.p: When you have specified your input, click Import.
For information on importing from other products, see .

section.title: Results
section.p: The data is imported into the selected target and you can begin to work with it. The external remains unchanged.
